RAS Memory Settings

Figure 7-15 RAS Memory

Table 7-8 RAS Memory Parameters

Field Name

Description

Memory RAS Config

Ensures that the memory reliability, availability, and serviceability (RAS) is configured for the server. Select any of the following options, depending on your requirement.

 • maximum performance

 • mirroring

 • lockstep

 • sparing

 • Platform Default

Sparing Mode

This option is available to choose sparing option for Memory RAS Config. Select dimm-sparing, spare DIMM or rank-sparing.

Mirroring Mode

This option is to choose the mirroring option for Memory RAS Config. Select inter socket, intra-socket, or Platform Default.

NUMA

Provides NUMA support. Select disabled, enabled, or Platform default.

LV DDR Mode

The system prioritizes low voltage or high frequency memory operations. Select any of the following options power-saving-mode, performance-mode, or Platform Default.

DRAM Refresh Rate

This option controls the refresh interval rate for internal memory
